item.title: Help with this
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“matty matt, post:5, topic:516504”]what is the file that makes it look for clientconf\

Edit: it would be the settings file.

Edit new question: why are all the rscd files taken out of sources???[/quote]
Cos its hard to copy over a cache, there all the same.

Read full topic

item.description:

matty matt:

what class

it literally tells you what class and what line to look at

item.title: Help with this
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“matty matt, post:1, topic:516504”][code] [java] clientconf\Items.rscd (The system cannot find the path specified
[java] clientconf\Textures.rscd (The system cannot find the path specif

[java] clientconf\Animations.rscd (The system cannot find the path spec

[java] clientconf\Spells.rscd (The system cannot find the path specifie
[java] clientconf\Prayers.rscd (The system cannot find the path specifi
[java] clientconf\Tiles.rscd (The system cannot find the path specified
[java] clientconf\Doors.rscd (The system cannot find the path specified
[java] clientconf\Elevation.rscd (The system cannot find the path speci

[java] clientconf\Objects.rscd (The system cannot find the path specifi
[java] Exception in thread “Thread-3” java.lang.NullPointerException
[java] at org.rscdaemon.client.entityhandling.EntityHandler.load(En
ler.java:169)
[java] at org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.loadConfigFilter(mudclient
5)
[java] at org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.startGame(mudclient.java:2

[java] at org.rscdaemon.client.GameWindow.run(GameWindow.java:216)
[java] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)[/code][/quote]

The error message explains the error itself. the program cant find your “clientconf” folder. either rename your config folder “clientconf” or edit the class to load whatever you have your config folder named

Read full topic
